reviews.review_msg: great teacher; i hate poetry. the students in this class think that poetry means easy reading and get upset when they realize that they actually have to work.

Messed up prof ever. She is lazy and all over the place. All her worksheets she hands out are full of typos and grammar errors. Don't know how she became a professor. All her lectures are useless, but still expects us to know details of useless stuff. Regret taking this course so much.

I would not take her class again. I believe she has a fear of public speaking as she consistently seemed uncomfortable while speaking. Mumbled through class without and mic and the words you could hear were of no academic value. She should rethink if she would really like to teach.
Worst professor EVER. Goes over the same poem for three lectures. Doesn't teach the necessary information, yet gives out the hardest quizzes.

The worst professor I've had so far. Reads off a script for lectures, rather than teaching. Sometimes rude or condescending. Passionate about her work but the TA's helped more than her teaching. VERY VERY bored in all her lectures.

Wonderful experience with him in Engl 102W. Lectures were interesting and engaging. Course material isn't hard - show up for lecture because his notes are important. He is very clear with his expectations and course material. He emphasizes what will be on the exam, and well prepares his students. Would definitely recommend a class with him.
I'm basing my clarity rating off his final exam, because all my papers were marked by my TA. Everton is passionate and always willing to help, one of the best profs at SFU

Everton was alright.  He acted like he was auditioning for Robin William's role in Dead Poets Society.  His craziness was just a bit too much for me to enjoy the class.  Also, his TA's tend to mark super hard; I've gotten better marks in a 300 level English class.  Overall, I wouldn't recommend, although he is quite attractive.

Everton is my North, my South, my East and West,
 My working week and my Sunday rest. -- Highly recommended.

Tiffany is an absolutely amazing human being. She's funny, knowledgeable, helpful, and very approachable. She marked very fairly. Her final was challenging though. Not because of the content, but because she stuffed a 3 hour exam in a 2 hour period. I learned a lot, and I genuinely appreciate poetry after taking this class. If she's the prof, take!

Great lecturer, his lectures are very interesting does a great job of keeping students engaged. Final was pretty straightforward, I thought his grading scheme was very fair. Probably my favourite professor at SFU!

This man is quite crazy, he goes off on tangents about the strangest things. The class is pretty good, the short papers are not bad so make the most of your marks there. The term paper is 8 pages so really try to start early on that one. Theres no midterm so thats always good. And make sure to take notes about what he thinks about poems.
Awesome lectures.  Really helps if you're at the lectures, they're entertaining and interesting.  And it helps with poem reference for the final.
He is a GREAT teacher, he always makes lectures interesting and you can tell he really enjoys poetry! I actually enjoyed going to lecture, and he isn't too bad  to look at either :)

1st year, 1st sem, great class to take!  I loved it, it was a lot of fun.  James is an amazing prof who captivates you right from the start.  Towards midterms lectures get kind of dull, but that is only because the course content changes from context to form so it's not his fault.  He tries his best to make his lectures as entertaining as possible.
Never take this course if u have any respect for your GPA. I still regret choosing it over ENGL 101.
